pr_title: [#1679] Update JavaDoc of the Device Management APIs for status codes

timeline.bodyText:
IMHO we shouldn't list the possible status codes here at all but instead simply refer to the Device Registry Management API docs ...
@ctron @dejanb WDYT?
timeline.author: sophokles73
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -42,6 +42,9 @@ * @return A future indicating the outcome of the operation. The status will be *
    *
  • 201 Created if the device has been registered successfully.
    • + *
  • 400 Bad Request if the request to register the device is malformed.
    • + *
  • 401 Unauthorized if the authentication credentials are required, but missing.
    • + *
  • 403 Forbidden if the operation to register the device is not allowed.

replies.bodyText: 👍 FMPOV it is more effort to maintain the same information in 2 places and it could easily be not in sync at some point. Now I am also convinced that its better to simply refer to the Device Registry Management API docs and to remove the redundant information from the JavaDoc.
replies.author: kaniyan

replies.bodyText: @sophokles73 The link to the API docs are documented in the JavaDoc using @see. In this case I would simply remove the status code part from the JavaDoc. WDYT?
replies.author: kaniyan

replies.bodyText: I would rathe radd a link explicitly to the @return description so that the correlation is more explicit
replies.author: sophokles73
